alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:11PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ada, Boise, southwestern Valley, west central Elmore, southeastern Canyon, northwestern Owyhee and central Malheur Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 510 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms with an outflow boundary along a line extending from near Big Eddy to near Hidden Springs to 6 miles northeast of Givens Hot Springs to near Crowley. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph along the outflow boundary and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boise, Meridian, Kuna and Garden City around 520 PM MDT. Idaho City, Centerville, Pioneerville and Lucky Peak Dam around 530 PM MDT. Lowman, Swan Falls, Murphy and Reynolds around 540 PM MDT. Twin Springs, Big Foot Butte and Boise Stage Stop around 550 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
